website_summaries.verdict: The HP Color LaserJet 3600n is an average-performing color laser printer.
pros: The HP Color LaserJet 3600n is well designed, handles paper well, and has a low cost for consumables
cons: The HP Color LaserJet 3600n has limited expandability options and its text quality is not up to par

customer_reviews.title: Not what was promised
customer_reviews.text: the printer was advertised as refurbished and fully functioning, but it isn't. All print jobs were jamming from both feeders. I still can NOT print addresses on envelopes since the envelope feeder continually jams. After calls for some service, I was told, "clean the rollers". I would have expected the seller would have done that since it was advertised as refurbished. I constantly have been cleaning all the paper feed rollers, with still no luck with envelopes. I'm sure now with the continuous jams, other feed mechanisms are now out of alignment. DO NOT buy from this vendor if you want or need customer service after the sale. I doesn't exist!
customer_reviews.author: E. Speiker

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: After few months it started showing an error. It doesn’t have warranty, you lost your money.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, has been a rock of Gibraltar so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lester L Jones

customer_reviews.title: HP Color printer works well
customer_reviews.text: The HP Color LaserJet 3600n Printer was easy to set up and works well with our Macs. The print quality is good. The real test will be how well it works after 10-50 thousand pages, and that will take time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Konrad

customer_reviews.title: damaged internals
customer_reviews.text: This machine was sent to me used, but in NEW condition. The transfer roller was bent and the metal guide bracket was bent as well. The image units were also missing. I could not test the machine, due to incomplete machine.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Relieved it's good!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to order this same printer when the other one "died" because of the ink already purchased. It was exactly the same if not better and was seamless switching out the old for the new. This is not a state-of-the-art laser color printer but serves our purposes well.
customer_reviews.author: msc

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I paid $432 for this printer including shipping. I could have paid over $1,000 for a newer model, but the 3600N is a work horse and I have 3 of them, so I thought I give a refurbished one a try. It arrived on time in good shape. The print quality was not as good as I would have liked. It was a little out of alignment, so the print was a little blurry. We have calibrated it and done some other adjustments we found on the web and we got the quality to an acceptable level. I'm not sure if this is the best I can expect from a refurb or if this if the best Advanced-Printers can do.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gallo

customer_reviews.title: defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Would not feed most the time and when it would the drum overheated after just a three pages initiating a shut down. This was not tested or someone would have known. Had to pay fifty dollars to ship back a couple months ago and still no refund.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Buy local.
customer_reviews.text: Paper tray did not function, fortunately I had one from my old machine. Second tray doesn't work. Seller offered to make an adjustment but I was not confident it could be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: LaserJet 3600N Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a replacement for one that we had that was identical. It is working great. Your service was quick and trouble free. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Diane Newberry

customer_reviews.title: ... new network card in it the network card was bad
customer_reviews.text: it works find after installing a new network card in it the network card was bad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good old printer, but it won't work on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: A great printer that I've used for years and years, but it will not work with Windows 10. No matter what anyone tells you, it won't. I've tried installing the drivers with the HP utilities.over and over and it simply doesn't work. When connected with the USB the computer won't even recognise that it's there. I've replaced it with a current HP color laser.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Preston

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, lousy networking software
customer_reviews.text: It prints beautiful color pages most of the time. But getting connected to it over the home network is challenging. It just works for some computers and it just doesn't for others. Even the ones that it works for, it forgets how to work now and then requiring a reboot of the PC. This is the second network HP printer (out of two) I've had this problem with. I've replaced one of them with an Epson equivalent, and now all computers in the house can use it reliably. I'll eventually replace my color laserjet with a non-HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Worst HP I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT do manual duplexing like it says. The drivers just don't work under Vista, and you will waste 1/2 a ream of paper trying to get it to work before giving up (with the latest drivers). The paper feeding is junk and jams/misaligns paper all the time because the alignment guides are only a couple inches. It is noisy. Even new, it has terrible squeaking and groaning sounds. In comparison, I have an 11-year old HP 4000 duplexer which never misses a beat, runs like a well-oiled machine, and has jammed maybe 2 or 3 times in it's entire life. You can guess which printer gets used most. HP has gone down the tubes creating junk printers like this.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Loud, Grinding Noise after 1 year (out of warranty)
customer_reviews.text: The Printer prints fines, decent colors acceptable quality. The major problem is that basically after 1 year of light to medium use, the noise is unbearable, it sounds as the gears are falling out, it is horrible. By now this printer is no longer in productions because this is how HP operates. Can't believe that after 1 year it is a piece of junk! Think twice when purchasing a Color printer, don't sacrifice cost for workmanship or quality. Don't recommend this printer or similar one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: First I wanted to counter the current "most helpful negative review" person: HP *does* have Windows Vista drivers for this printer. In fact I use it with my Vista laptop and it prints just fine. Otherwise I just wanted to say that while I've only had the printer a couple of weeks, it prints great - fast and nice. Comes with full toner cartridges too. Getting it for $250 seems like a no brainer to me - I replaced our HP 1000 Laserjet with this. So far I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Need to reset Factory Setting to save on expensive cartridges.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one in our office. Employee with the first one would toss out the cartridges when the printer would stop operating with the "Replace Cartridge" message even though the copies looked great. After I got mine, I realized that you could override the number of copies before a new cartridge is needed. We kept upping the number (factory setting was 5000 -- we are now at 15,000!). Sure saves money as the replacements are $115-150 each.
customer_reviews.author: BMMA

customer_reviews.title: If you can handle the toner costs, a great printer!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this printer for 6 or so years....it's amazing. It's networked in to our neighborhood(our neighbors are all pretty much relatives) and it's been flawless. I am amazed so many folks have had so many problems. It may not be the fastest, but a great value for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: HP Color Laserjet 3600n Printer
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product as I have had to replace the electrostatic transfer mechanism on this printer 2 times due to mechanical failures. Each lasting an average of only 7 months with minimal use. I have been using HP printing technology for 12 years and have had 5 HP printers 2 of them utilizing color laser technology, models 3600n and color laser 1518ni. HP's Color Laser technology group has been a let down. On a positive note my black and white laser printers are working very well.
customer_reviews.author: DesignFish

customer_reviews.title: Soldiered on for many years
customer_reviews.text: A great printer, used daily for several years without any problems. Easy wireless set up to other computers. If I had one complaint it would be the price of the cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: EKR

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT SUPPORT TWO-SIDED PRINTING
customer_reviews.text: The claims are deceptive, if you have a Mac, you will ONLY print on one side of the paper. I have tried, and tinkered, and tried, and it never works the way the documentation claims. (MacOS 10.5.6, latest drivers as far as I know.) Maybe it's "not HP's fault" (i.e., Apple's fault), but pointing fingers does not fix the problem, does it? I tried downloading the "MacOS drivers", it provides a DMG, containing a file, that is not one that I recognize (it opens "Automator" when I double-click it). FAIL, FAIL, FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: dr2chase

customer_reviews.title: Horrible printer, beware!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has had more problems than I can list. All I will say is that is only worked for the first month we owned it. HP sent replacement parts twice, which worked for about a week each time. Now HP will not exchange or replace the printer at all. I was a loyal HP customer until now!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Gan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I've ever had. It jams frequently. It does not like to take cardstock from either tray. It takes forever to proces something that has a graphic on it. The print turns out light and hard to read. If tray 2 is not completely full, you get an error message that the tray is empty and the printer won't print until you fill it up. Each time after it prints, it calibrates itself for nearly a minute -- when you combine that with all the jamming, it just leads to further delys in printing. Way to expensive for the quality. HP support is less than helpful. If I could give it zero stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: SamPalm

customer_reviews.title: Planned Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Purchased(2)printers, both lasted less than 3 years. I thought HP was trying to make money on the toners, but it was cheaper to replace them with a higher quality Brother Color Laser. I have dozens of HP models and most of them last more than 5 years. Maintenance parts were too high price. Cheaper to buy a new printer. Had good luck with CP1518i but it's slower.
customer_reviews.author: IT YPSI

customer_reviews.title: PRINTING ENVELOPES PROBLEM CAN'T BE SOLVED!
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer for our office. This printer has a problem printing envelopes. When you print an envelope the envelope comes out wrinkled and sealed. I called HP customer service and they told me they had many complaints about this issue from other customers and that unfortunately there is no solution for it. They suggested to upgrade the printer for some other model. The price of the model they suggested was $1,200. We had to return the printer and get another brand. Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael White

customer_reviews.title: HP Color Laser Jet 3600 - Great printer - Amazing price
customer_reviews.text: I am a real-estate agent in a small town and send out a thousand or so post cards monthly. This printer prints beautifully and very clearly, even on card stock. I highly recommend this printer to individuals and small businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Bradford Lopez

customer_reviews.title: HP 3600n Downgrade from the old HP 3550
customer_reviews.text: I recently replaced my happily owned 3550 with a bad sensor with a new 3600n. I didn't even consider the fact that this "upgrade" would perform worse than the previous model. But It Does! If you are looking for sharp lines & rich colors this is not the machine for you. By comparison to the 3550 it is washed out with crappy line art. The text is crisp, but too faint.
customer_reviews.author: réh

customer_reviews.title: Love it with Windows 7 64Bit
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what people are talking about. This unit works great with Windows 7 64-Bit. The correct drivers are right there on the Drivers & Downloads page for it. One of the better network color lasers as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Fuller

customer_reviews.title: HP 3600N STINKS! Must Read
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 HP 3600N printers for my office. HP will not support Windows 7. Google the topic for other angry 3600N owners! I have to tell you that as a an business owner I'd be out of business if I ran my company like HP!. They refuse to support Windows 7 users and owners of their 3600N printers. I need to buy 6 new computers and 12 monitors for my office... I'll never buy another HP product as long as I live! Hear me loud and clear HP... You should be ashamed of yourselves! I've never posted a review like this before... I hope I will never have to again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sokoler

customer_reviews.title: Great for Office Use
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th 3600n that our company has purchased. We have yet to have any problems with these machines and the printing quality is great for presentation packets and various other office printing applications. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MDR

customer_reviews.title: The 3600 sucks
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I've ever made. After every print, residue from the last print gets on it. Also, my red in cartridge, my blue ink cartridge, and my yellow ink cartridge all leak. Steer clear of hp products.
customer_reviews.author: Aunseth

customer_reviews.title: Great color printer
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous quality in the color printing. The cartridges are a little tricky to get in place correctly, but other than that, it's a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: HP Color LaserJet 3600n
customer_reviews.text: The printer so far has worked perfectly on a small network. It was priced right and shipped in a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: William Suthoff

customer_reviews.title: Easy transaction, item exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy transaction. Very fast shipping, no problems. Item exactly as described. Refurbished but in excellent condition with all new cartridges (no drum problems). Would definitely recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Victims' Intervention Program

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great printer for my family. We use it often and it has not let us down in any way!! Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Dhillon

customer_reviews.title: DON'T throw your money away.
customer_reviews.text: We used to swear by hp products. Evidently hp is no longer the company it once was. This printer is too big, too slow, too noisy, too expensive - and replacing the toner cartridges will leave you without food for weeks. Almost immediately after the warranty ended our printer began failing. Look elsewhere for a high quality printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bitman

product_meta.title: HP Color Laserjet 3600n Printer (Q5987A#ABA)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Create professional-looking, colorful documents with the HP Color LaserJet 3600dn Printer that uses HP's unique ColorSphere Toner 4-color process to produce brilliant colors and sharp text. This Energy Star qualified printer is also fast, and it offers two large paper trays, and an optional third tray, that help to minimize time wasted refilling paper. The built-in automatic duplexer allows for dual-sided printing which helps save on paper costs.

 Print accurate 600 x 600 dpi documents at speeds of up to 17 pages per minute in both black and white or full-color. The 360 MHz processor and 128 MB of on-board memory help to keep the LaserJet 3600dn performing at its best over the long haul, and with a maximum monthly duty cycle of 50,000 pages, this printer can handle large-capacity jobs with ease.

 The HP LaserJet 3600dn will grow as your business does with its optional wireless 802.11 b/g LAN (not included) for setting up a wireless network. Not ready for wireless? Setup a network using this printer's built-in Jetdirect Fast Ethernet connection, or stay connected using the high-speed USB 2.0 input.

 Compatible with both Windows and Macintosh, the HP LaserJet 3600dn measures 15.7 x 20.07 x 16.7 inches (WxDxH) and weighs 61.6 pounds. It's backed by a 1-year, next-day, onsite limited warranty.

 What's in the Box
HP Color LaserJet 3600dn Printer; HP LaserJet print cartridge; in-box documentation (Getting Started Guide); software drivers and documentation on CD-ROM; power cable; 100-sheet multipurpose tray; 250-sheet input tray; HP Jetdirect Fast Ethernet embedded print server; automatic two-sided printing; pre-installed, full-capacity 6,000-page black and 4,000-page cyan, magenta and yellow HP Color LaserJet print cartridges with HP ColorSphere Toner.
feature_bullets: Print in full-color at speeds up to 17 ppm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars65 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
